summary: This bill, the Transboundary Aquifer Assessment Program Act (TAAP Act), amends the United States-Mexico Transboundary Aquifer Assessment Act to reauthorize the program. It focuses on assessing and managing shared groundwater resources between the US and Mexico. The bill specifically addresses the designation of priority transboundary aquifers, adding Arizona, and adjusts the authorization of appropriations for the program, allocating $1,500,000 annually from fiscal years 2026-2033. It also modifies the sunset clause related to the program's authorization.
